item.description: Structure Fire; INC#1690; 09:25PM; 1655 W 48th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3EnyMKT; Vermont Square; Two-story structure (residential over commercial) with heavy smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E226 E266 E294 RA266 SQ21 T26 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update River Rescue; INC#0639; 11:59AM; 6600 Winnetka Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/3srcPs5; Winnetka; With coordination by LAFD Swift Water Rescue Team, firefighters raised the patient up to street level (on the bridge) with a litter basket operation. Firefighter-paramedics evaluated the patient on scene and have transported the patient to a local hospital.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; AO2 BC10 BC17 CM40 CM42 E109 E239 E273 E288 E290 E293 E72 E73 E83 E88 E99 EM14 H4 H5 HA4 HA5 HR3 RA39 RA72 RA83 RH114 RH214 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T73 T88 T90 T93 UR88; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

River Rescue; INC#0639; 11:15AM; 6615 Winnetka Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/3srcPs5; Winnetka; Firefighters have located one male stranded on a pillar/abutment above the flowing LA River. A litter basket rescue operation is being set up, as well as a safety catch point down stream as a precaution, should he fall into the moving water below. ; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; AO2 BC10 BC17 CM40 CM42 E109 E239 E273 E288 E290 E293 E72 E73 E83 E88 E99 EM14 H4 H5 HA4 HA5 HR3 RA39 RA72 RA83 RH114 RH214 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T73 T88 T90 T93 UR88; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0748; 12:56PM; 20200 W Cantara St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7lns2; #Winnetka; The first arriving 50 LAFD Firefighters took just 36 minutes in a well coordinated offensive fire attack to access, confine and fully extinguish flames within a single three-story residential (townhome?) unit of two occupied floors above a ground level garage. Firefighters quickly and safely evacuated a mobility impaired female resident from a unit adjacent to the fire. No civilian or responder injuries have been reported. The fire cause remains under investigation.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC14 BC15 BC17 CM42 E103 E104 E106 E107 E273 E287 E288 E293 E296 E89 E93 EM17 HR3 RA104 RA106 RA889 RA96 T73 T87 T88 T93 T96 UR88 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0748; 12:20PM; 20200 W Cantara St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7lns2; Winnetka; PRELIM: Three story apartment building (2 occupied floors over parking) with heavy fire from the first floor; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E104 E106 E296 T96; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0053; 02:46AM; 1888 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7BHJg; Downtown; 50 LAFD Firefighters took less than two hours in well-coordinated defensive firefighting operations to extinguish stubborn flames throughout the second floor of a vacant and structurally unstable 50' x 100' combination one- and two-story former medical clinic of unreinforced masonry construction, the site of a previous fire. One firefighter has been taken to an area hospital for treatment of a non-life threatening ankle injury. No other injuries reported. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0053; 02:20AM; 1888 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7BHJg; Downtown; Address Corrected from Washington Blvd. 50 LAFD Firefighters continue in extended defensive firefighting operation against stubborn flames on the second floor of a vacant and structurally unstable 50' x 100' combination one- and two-story former medical clinic of unreinforced masonry construction, the site of a previous fire. One firefighter is currently being evaluated at scene for a possible ankle injury. No other injuries reported.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0053; 12:51AM; 100 E Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yWzNIL; Historic South Central; PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations at a vacant and structurally unstable 100' x 100' two story medical clinic, the site of a previous fire, with heavy fire on the upper floor.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Traffic Collision; INC#0901; 02:00PM; 6000 W Cadillac Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J6XIKj; MidCity; Solo sport utility vehicle struck two adult male pedestrians before colliding with a retaining wall outside a storage building. No entrapment. One of the pedestrians with severe lower body trauma was immediately taken to an area Trauma Center in critical condition. The other pedestrian appears to have very minor (graze?) injury, and is still being evaluated at scene. The adult female SUV driver appears to have sustained minor injury, and is being transported to an area hospital in fair condition. Media Inquiries: LAPD West Traffic Division (Incident #2252); FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E68 E94 EM9 RA29 RA58 RA61; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0901; 01:39PM; 6000 W Cadillac Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J6XIKj; MidCity; PRELIM: Solo vehicle struck and injured two pedestrians before colliding with storage building. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E68 E94 EM9 RA29 RA58 RA61; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey
